React introduction

  • React is currently the most famous JavaScript Library for building UI interface.
  • For every DOM objext, there is one corresponding "Vitual DOM object". Using virtual DOM, the benefit is we can only update needed onjects in real DOM.
  • React use JSX which combines JavaScript togetehr with HTML together.

Hello World Application

  • JSX Element.

    • JSX element looks exactly same as HTML. Only difference is it in JavaScript file.

    The following is one examples code:

    const title = ‹h1›Hello world‹/h1›;


  • Rendering JSX

    • We use React render method to display "Hello World". The following is the whole code:

    import React from 'react';
    import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';
    const title = ‹h1›Hello world‹/h1›;
    ReactDOM.render(title, document.getElementById('app'));

React Component

React Compoent is a very useful class responsible for one job.

To set up your own React Component, you need to subclass React.Component.

Every component, you must fill in at least render method. Please see following whole code:

import React from 'react';
import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';
class MyComponent extends React.Component {
  render() {
    return ‹h1›Hello world‹/h1›;
  }
}
ReactDOM.render( ‹MyComponent /›, document.getElementById('app') );

Function Component

Function component is React component defined as JavaScript function.

Function components must return JSX.

Function components may accept a props parameter. Expect it to be a JavaScript object.

export const MyComponent = () => {
  return ‹h1›Hello world‹/h1›;
}

Whole code as follows:

import React from 'react';
import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';
export const MyComponent = () => {
  return ‹h1›Hello world‹/h1›;
}
ReactDOM.render( ‹MyComponent /›, document.getElementById('app') );

React Input

React input just like html input, but we need to add handler function track every change of the input.

We use component state to store the content and use it if need.

Whole code we can design like the following:

import React from 'react';
import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';
export class Input extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props);
    this.state = {userInput: ""};
    this.handleUserInput = this.handleUserInput.bind(this);
  }
  handleUserInput(e) {
    this.setState({userInput: e.target.value});
  }
  render() {
    return (
      ‹div›
      ‹input type="text" onChange={this.handleUserInput} value={this.state.userInput} name="text" id="text"/›
        ‹h1›{this.state.userInput}‹/h1›
      ‹/div›
    );
  }
}
ReactDOM.render( ‹Input /›, document.getElementById('app') );
